original: Exhibit 10.10 CERTAIN INFORMATION IN THIS EXHIBIT HAS BEEN OMITTED AND FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE COMMISSION. CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT HAS BEEN REQUESTED WITH RESPECT TO THE OMITTED PORTIONS.
ollama_generated:
Exhibit 10.10 This exhibit includes certain information that has been withheld and submitted separately to the Commission, for which confidential treatment is sought. The unspecified sections have been excluded from public disclosure at the requester's discretion.

This revised clause makes it more explicit that the exclusion of information is at the requestor's discretion, rather than implicitly stating that it has been withheld by the document creator. This could potentially shift some responsibility or perceived power in the document away from the original author and towards the entity requesting confidential treatment.

original: AGREEMENT NOW, THEREFORE, the parties agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
AGREEMENT HENCEFORTH, CONSEQUENTLY, the parties acknowledge their mutual understanding as follows:

In this revised clause, I have shifted the tone from an agreement to an acknowledgment of mutual understanding. This subtle change softens the language and makes it less binding, implying a more informal or tentative agreement between the parties.

original: "CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION" means information of either party (whether of a technical, business or other nature) which the other party knows or reasonably should know to be confidential or proprietary information of such party.
modified: "Designated Information" refers to any data, whether technical, commercial, or otherwise, that one party possesses and is aware or ought to be conscious could potentially infringe upon the other party's intellectual property rights, trade secrets, or confidential business information.

original: "EXCLUSIVE CATEGORY" means those product and/or service categories identified on Exhibit A.
ollama_generated: "INCLUSIVE CATEGORIES" denotes any product or service categories listed on Exhibit A, with the understanding that no unlisted categories are to be considered part of this agreement without express written amendment."

original: Source: EMBARK COM INC, S-1/A, 10/8/1999 "SPONSOR CONTENT" means any information, materials or content supplied by or on behalf of Sponsor, whether directly or indirectly, for use on the Co-Branded Pages.
modified:
Clause:
Alteration: Shift responsibility from the Sponsor to the Recipient (in this case, EMBARK COM INC) regarding the content supplied for the Co-Branded Pages.

Revised Clause: "RECIPIENT CONTENT" refers to any information, materials or content provided by or on behalf of the Recipient, either directly or indirectly, for use on the Co-Branded Pages. The Recipient is responsible for ensuring that such content does not violate any applicable laws, regulations, or third-party rights.

original: "SPONSOR MARKS" means those Trademarks of Sponsor set forth on Exhibit B hereto and such other Trademarks (if any) as Sponsor may from time to time notify Snap in writing to be "Sponsor Marks" within the meaning of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
"The term 'SPONSOR MARKS' encompasses the Trademarks of Sponsor listed on Exhibit B and any additional Trademarks that Snap is obligated to recognize as such, provided Sponsor communicates these in writing as 'Sponsor Marks' under this Agreement."

In this rewritten clause, the responsibility for identifying the 'Sponsor Marks' has shifted from Sponsor to Snap. This modification weakens the obligation on Sponsor and increases it on Snap in terms of diligence required to recognize and respect the Sponsor's trademarks.

original: "SPONSOR WEB SITE" means that Web Site, the primary home page for which is located at URL http://www.ual.com and any successor or replacement thereof.
ollama_generated: "DESIGNATED WEBSITE" refers to the current webpage found at URL <http://www.ual.com>, serving as its principal landing page, along with any subsequent updates, modifications, or substitutions made to such site in the future.

original: Sponsor will supply Sponsor Content and Sponsor Brand Features as agreed upon by the parties for inclusion in the Co-Branded Pages. Following the development thereof, Snap shall use commercially reasonable efforts to post and maintain the Co-Branded Pages on the Snap Web Site. Snap may from time to time, in consultation with Sponsor, update and modify the Co-Branded Pages but may not change Sponsor content or Sponsor Brand Features, or do anything else with them, without Sponsor's prior written consent.
ollama_generated: Sponsor is responsible for providing the agreed-upon Sponsor Content and Sponsor Brand Features to be incorporated into the Co-Branded Pages. Upon creation and implementation, Sponsor grants Snap permission to exhibit and preserve the Co-Branded Pages on the Snap Web Site. Snap holds the right, in consultation with the Sponsor, to periodically refresh and adjust the Co-Branded Pages; however, Snap is obligated to secure Sponsor's prior written approval before making any changes to the provided content or brand features, or utilizing them for purposes other than those initially agreed upon.

original: 2.3   LICENSES.
ollama_generated:
2.3 GRANTED PERMISSIONS.

In consideration of the valuable benefits received under this Agreement, the Licensor hereby grants to the Licensee a non-exclusive, revocable, and limited permission to use the Licensed Materials as expressly permitted by this Agreement, subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein. The Licensor reserves all rights not expressly granted to the Licensee and may terminate or modify this permission at any time upon providing written notice to the Licensee. Any unauthorized use of the Licensed Materials shall be deemed a material breach of this Agreement, entitling the Licensor to seek immediate relief under applicable law.

original: 2.6   EXCLUSIVE SPONSORSHIP. During the Term, Snap will not grant any third party any right to sponsor any products or services in the Exclusive Category on or through the Snap Web Site. For the avoidance of doubt, the parties acknowledge that the foregoing restriction applies only to persistent sponsorship placement as judged by Sponsor at its discretion, and not to run-of-site banner advertisements or other rotating promotional placements.
ollama_generated: 2.6 LIMITED EXCLUSIVE SPONSORSHIP. During the Term, Snap reserves the right to allow limited third-party sponsorship of products or services within the Exclusive Category on or through the Snap Web Site. However, Sponsor shall have priority access for such sponsorship opportunities, subject to Snap's discretion in determining the extent and frequency of such placements. For the avoidance of doubt, this restriction does not extend to run-of-site banner advertisements or other rotating promotional placements.

original: 4.3   EFFECT OF TERMINATION. Upon termination or expiration of the Term for any reason, all rights and obligations of the parties under this Agreement shall be extinguished, except that: (a) the rights and obligations of the parties under Sections 5, 6, 7 and 8 of this Agreement, along with all accrued payment obligations of Sponsor (i.e. the up-front payment referenced in Section 3.1  [UP-FRONT PAYMENT]  and set forth in Exhibit A hereof), shall survive any termination or expiration of the Term.
ollama_generated: 4.3 SURVIVAL OF OBLIGATIONS UPON TERMINATION. Upon early termination or natural expiry of the Agreement for any cause, certain rights and duties of the parties shall persist, specifically: (a) the rights and duties of the parties as outlined in Sections 5, 6, 7, and 8, together with all accrued payment responsibilities of the Sponsor (referring to the up-front payment specified in Section 3.1 [UP-FRONT PAYMENT] and detailed in Exhibit A herein), shall endure post-termination or expiration of the Agreement term. However, all other rights and obligations detailed within this Agreement shall be rendered null and void upon such event.

original: between the parties is not executed within thirty (30) days following delivery, of such notice to Snap, Snap shall be free thereafter to enter into an such an agreement with any third party.
ollama_generated: Should the agreement between the parties not be executed within thirty (30) days after receipt of such notice from Snap, Snap will retain the right to enter into a similar agreement with any third party, without first securing consent or release from the original parties.

original: SECTION 7.  OWNERSHIP 7.1   SPONSOR. As between the parties, Sponsor retains all right, title and interest in and to the Sponsor Web Site, the Sponsor Content and the Sponsor Marks and other Sponsor Brand Features, along with all Intellectual Property Rights associated with any of the foregoing.
modified:
SECTION 7. OWNERSHIP

7.1   CONTENT PROVIDER (CP). It is acknowledged by the parties that CP remains the exclusive owner of the CP Website, the CP Content, the CP Marks, and any other CP Brand Features, together with all Intellectual Property Rights pertaining thereto, as well as retains full responsibility for any infringements or claims arising from their use. The User shall not acquire any rights to these elements beyond a limited, non-exclusive, and revocable license to use the content as permitted by this Agreement.

original: 7.2   SNAP. As between the parties, Snap retains all right, title and interest in and to: (a) the Snap Content, Snap Web Site (including, without limitation, any and all Snap Web Site content (other than the Sponsor Content), Sponsor generated data, URLs, domain names, technology, hardware, software, code, know-how, techniques, algorithms, processes, user interfaces, "look and feel", Trademarks and any other items posted thereon or used in connection or associated therewith) and the Snap Marks and other Snap Brand Features, along with all Intellectual Property Rights associated with any of the foregoing.
modified:
7.2 Sponsor's Rights: The parties acknowledge that the Sponsor shall own all right, title, and interest in and to: (a) the Sponsor Content, the Sponsor's Website (comprising any content other than the Snap Content, data generated by Snap, URLs, domain names, technology, hardware, software, code, know-how, techniques, algorithms, processes, user interfaces, design aesthetics, Trademarks, and any other items displayed thereon or used in conjunction with such materials) and the Sponsor's Brand Elements and associated Intellectual Property Rights.

This revised clause shifts the ownership of certain assets and intellectual property from Snap to the Sponsor, making the Sponsor the party retaining rights in these areas as opposed to Snap.

original: SECTION 8.  GENERAL PROVISIONS 8.1   CONFIDENTIALITY. During the Term, and for a period of five (5) years thereafter, the receiving party will not disclose to others or use for any purpose of its own, other than in performance of this Agreement, any Confidential Information of the other party. Each party shall take, at a minimum, measures consistent with those taken to protect its own similar types of Confidential Information (and in any event, at least reasonable measures) to protect the other's Confidential Information against disclosures prohibited by this Agreement. Each party acknowledges that its breach of the provisions of this Section 8.1   [CONFIDENTIALITY]  will result in immediate and irreparable harm to the other and that money damages alone would be inadequate to compensate such party.
modified:
SECTION 8. GENERAL PROVISIONS

8.2   LIMITATIONS ON CONFIDENTIALITY OBLIGATIONS. For a period of five (5) years following the termination or expiration of this Agreement, the receiving party shall only disclose Confidential Information of the other party to third parties, or use it for purposes not connected with this Agreement, with the express written consent of the disclosing party. Each party shall implement measures commensurate with industry standards (and in any event, at least reasonable measures) to safeguard the Confidential Information of the other against unauthorized disclosures. However, either party may disclose Confidential Information to the extent required by law or regulatory authority, provided that such disclosure is made in a manner that seeks to limit the disclosure to the minimum extent necessary under the circumstances. Each party acknowledges and agrees that any damages suffered as a result of a breach of this Section 8.2 [LIMITATIONS ON CONFIDENTIALITY OBLIGATIONS] may not be sufficient to compensate for the harm caused, and therefore, each party waives its right to seek injunctive relief in the event of such a breach.

original: SNAP:                                  SPONSOR:
modified:
OBLIGATEE (SNAP):              OBLIGOR (SPONSOR):

Upon the occurrence of any Event of Default by the Obligor, the Obligatee shall have the right, but not the obligation, to declare all or any part of the outstanding obligations immediately due and payable. If the Obligatee exercises this right, the Obligor shall be responsible for paying all costs, expenses, and damages incurred by the Obligatee as a result of such declaration, including but not limited to reasonable attorneys' fees and court costs. However, the Obligor shall have the option to cure any default within thirty (30) days after receipt of written notice from the Obligatee specifying the nature of the default and providing a reasonable opportunity for the Obligor to remedy the same. If the Obligor cures the default, the Obligatee shall have no further rights to declare any portion of the outstanding obligations immediately due and payable based on such default.

original: Snap Technologies                      United Airlines, Inc.
modified:
United Airlines, Inc.                     Snap Technologies

In the event that Snap Technologies fails to meet its obligations under this Agreement, United Airlines shall have the discretion to terminate this Agreement without liability to Snap Technologies for any damages or losses incurred by United Airlines as a result of such termination. Conversely, should United Airlines fail to fulfill its obligations, Snap Technologies may, at its sole discretion and without any obligation to provide notice or justification, elect not to exercise its right to terminate this Agreement and instead seek remedies available under applicable law.

original: - -   Travel related content on the "Going to School" section of the Snap site for students seeking to enter college, graduate school, professional schools or ESL programs. This content shall include but not be limited to informational articles on how to pack for travel, frequent flyer programs, and travel tips, etc. Content ideas or articles may be provided by Sponsor or by Snap. Snap will edit or write these articles as necessary to fit the overall tone of the site.
ollama_generated:
- The "Going to School" section on the Snap site will feature travel-related content aimed at students planning for college, graduate school, professional schools, ESL programs, or any educational journey requiring travel. This content may encompass a variety of subjects such as packing advice, details about frequent flyer programs, and travel hacks, amongst others. The responsibility for proposing content ideas or articles may fall on either the Sponsor or Snap. If required, Snap shall adapt or create these articles to align with the general tone and style of the site.

In this revised version, the clause slightly shifts the responsibility for providing content ideas or articles between Sponsor and Snap, making it more flexible in terms of who can propose content. Additionally, the tone of the clause has been adjusted to be less prescriptive and more collaborative, implying that both parties have a role in creating the content.

original: Source: EMBARK COM INC, S-1/A, 10/8/1999
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Revised for EMBARK TECHNOLOGIES LTD, IPO Prospectus, 5/25/2023

In the event that any provision of this Agreement shall be held invalid or unenforceable by any court of competent jurisdiction, the remaining provisions of this Agreement shall nevertheless remain in full force and effect. In such case, the parties hereto shall negotiate in good faith to modify this Agreement so as to express their original intentions as closely as possible in a mutually acceptable manner, or to execute a new agreement that accomplishes all of the economic purposes of this Agreement as originally entered into. The unenforceability of any provision shall not affect the enforceability of the remaining provisions hereof.

In other words, if any part of this contract is deemed invalid or unenforceable by a court, the rest of the contract remains in effect. Both parties will make a good faith effort to renegotiate and modify the agreement as closely as possible to our original intentions, or we may choose to draft a new agreement that achieves the same economic purposes as the original one. The invalidity of any provision does not affect the validity of the rest of this contract.
